metadata.title: CVE-2022-39046 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the GNU C Library (glibc) 2.36. When the syslog function is passed a crafted input string larger than 1024 bytes, it reads uninitialized memory from the heap and prints it to the target log file, potentially revealing a portion of the contents of the heap.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-39046` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

glibc-source - 2.36-0ubuntu3
libc-bin - 2.36-0ubuntu3
libc6 - 2.36-0ubuntu3
libc6-amd64 - 2.36-0ubuntu3
libc6-i386 - 2.36-0ubuntu3
libc6-prof - 2.36-0ubuntu3
libc6-s390 - 2.36-0ubuntu3
libc6-x32 - 2.36-0ubuntu3
locales - 2.36-0ubuntu3
locales-all - 2.36-0ubuntu3
nscd - 2.36-0ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: glibc package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.36-0ubuntu3').
